block.p: Dr. Jean Marie Cacciabaudo, a cardiologist, was married yesterday to Dr. William Maiorino Jr., an anesthesiologist. The Rev. Martin Klein officiated at St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in Babylon, N.Y.
The bride, a graduate of Georgetown University, and the bridegroom, who graduated magna cum laude from Colgate, received medical degrees from New York Medical College, where they met.

Dr. Jean Marie Cacciabaudo, a cardiologist, was married yesterday to Dr. William Maiorino Jr., an anesthesiologist. The Rev. Martin Klein officiated at St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in Babylon, N.Y.
The bride, a graduate of Georgetown University, and the bridegroom, who graduated magna cum laude from Colgate, received medical degrees from New York Medical College, where they met.

Dr. Cacciabaudo, 36, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the director of nuclear cardiology at Long Island Jewish Medical Center in New Hyde Park, N.Y., and an assistant professor of medicine at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine in the Bronx. Dr. Maiorino, 37, works at Good Samaritan Hospital in West Islip, N.Y.

The bride's parents, Adele Cacciabaudo and Dr. Nelson Cacciabaudo, live in Wantagh N.Y. Her father, a dentist, practices there. The bridegroom is a son of Marie and William Maiorino of Babylon. His father, a gynecologist, practices in West Islip.
